intro: Gnaphalium rosum, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, white to pale yellow composite flowers arranged in compact clusters. Its leaves are usually linear to oblanceolate, with a hairy surface. Native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, it thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
